moves.1. d4: One of my best games in quite awhile eventhough it finished almost a month ago. Although there were some mistakes by both myself and tag1153 the game ended very close. Hope you enjoy.
moves.1... Nf6: I decided to try something a little different for me.
moves.5. h3: probably a little early for this move, preparing for Nf3
moves.7. e3: opening up the white bishop and adding more to the center
moves.7... Nbd7: Nc6 most likely leads to d5
moves.8... e6: declining and protecting it with a different pawn to avoid doubled pawns and a half-open file
moves.9... Re8: bringing the rook to the center
moves.10. Bxf5 exf5 11. b4: continues to control center and threatens possible attacks on the queen side in the future
moves.12. a4 c5 13. dxc5 dxc5 14. b5 Ne4: and the attack begins. Double attack on the knight. If he moves the knight the rook on a1 will be captured
moves.15. Nd5: he seems to miss the bishop on g7
moves.16. Nd2: still missing the bishop but he ofers a trade of knights
moves.17... Bxa1: Now I remember about my bishop. Took one of us long enough. :)
moves.19... Ne4 20. Qb2: putting the queen on the open diagonal.
moves.20... Qh4: bring the queen into the game finally
